intro: Haloselinum, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-white leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that give them a distinctive silvery appearance. Haloselinum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
